result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcello L Holland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).
  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis and pay surcharge.  If this conviction is reversed, set aside or vacated he may qualify to have the DNA sample  data expunged if he meets conditions under the statute and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.
Pay all mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges by the end of probation 11/4/19.  Any unpaid balance is due and owing or a civil judgment is to  entered against defendant.
If revoked, DOC to collect monetary sums from prison fudns at a rate to be determined by the DOC during confinement and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Any unpaid balance at the end of this sentence to convert to civil judgment.

Defendant advised that he may not possess a firearm and if the defendant possesses a firearm within five (5) years of the completion of the sentence, he will be subject to a three (3) year mandatory Initial Confinement.
The Court informed the defendant of requirements and penalties applicable under s. 941.29(1m) or (4m).
Deenadnt advised he cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
Not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $300.00 at one time.
No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time.
May not have more than one phone number registered to your name at one time.
No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster or any body armor.
May not live where a firearm is kept.
May not be in any automobile where a firearm is present.
No  association with any known gang member, associate or affiliate.
No contact with any known illegal drug user.
No contact with any known illegal drug manufacturer or deliverer.
No violations of law rising to the level of probable cause.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfully complete recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  DOC must conduct drug and alcohol testing at least one time per month.

records.descr: Pet/determ eligibility for substance abuse program

records.addlTxt: Bail refund packet

Defendant Marcello L Holland in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  
Jessica Bellows on behalf of Randall L Schneider appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Deputy Court Clerk: sm

Matter in court for Sentencing. Hearing proceeds. 
Negotiations placed on the record by the State, defense counsel and defendant confirms.
PSI report received by parties. PSI reviewed by parties. 
Statements made by State, Defense counsel and Defendant. Additional Statement by: Trinaye R.

COURT ADVISES: the defendant that he must provide a DNA sample and pay surcharge, if this conviction is reversed, set aside or vacated he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets conditions under the statute and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored. Defendant advised that he may not possess a firearm and if the defendant possesses a firearm within 5 years of the completion of this sentence, he will be subject to a 3 year mandatory initial confinement.  

The Court informed the defendant of requirements and penalties applicable under s. 941.29(1m) or (4m).

AS TO COUNT 1
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 4 YEARS with 7 days credit - INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 2 YEARS  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 2 YEARS, Concurrent to Count 3

The Court STAYS this sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of 3 YEARS.

AS TO COUNT 3
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 3 YEARS  with  7 days credit - INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 1 YEAR  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 2 YEARS, Concurrent to Count 1

Court finds defendant IS  eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  The defendant IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

The Court STAYS this sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of 3 YEARS.


COURT FURTHER ORDERS:
- Provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis and pay surcharge
 -Pay all mandatory costs, assessments and surcharges by the end of  probation(11-04-2019), Any unpaid balance is due and owing or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant
- If revoked, Department of Corrections to collect monetary sums from prison funds at a rate to be determined by the DOC during confinement and as a condition of extended supervision- any unpaid balance at the end of this sentence to convert to civil judgment

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION (if revoked):
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment
- Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing at least 1 time per month
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution
- Defendant not to possess cash currency in an amount greater than $300.00 at one time
- No possession of more than one cell phone at any one time
- Defendant may not have more than one phone number registered to your name at one time 
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.  
- Defendant may not live where a firearm is kept
- Defendant may not be in any automobile where a firearm is present 
- Maintain employment 
- No association with any known gang member, associate or affiliate 
- No contact with any known illegal drug user
- No contact with any known illegal drug manufacturer or deliverer
- No violations of law rising to the level of probable cause

Defendant advised of his right to appeal this sentence.

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Presentence Investigation Report forwarded via email to AAG Schneider and Attorney Wineke this date per court order.

Defendant Marcello L Holland in court with attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke.  
Randall Schneider appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeds.  Negotiations set forth by the state and confirmed by defense.

AS TO COUNTS 1 and 3:  Defendant advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead NO CONTEST and was examined as to the plea.  Defendant advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  The Court conducts plea colloquy again at defendant's request.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Defendant advised that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms and he must provide dna sample and pay surcharge.  Defendant further advised that he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.  

AS TO COUNT 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on state's motion, the Court orders Count 2 DISMISSED AND READ-IN for the purpose of sentencing in Counts 1 and 3.

Joint request for Presentence Investigation Report granted.  The Court to allow parties to receive PSI report via email.  No change in bail; the Court reiterates compliance with bail conditions.
Filed, Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, Jury Instructions, and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Filed.  Count 1 and 2  REMAIN THE SAME.

COUNT 3 AMENDED TO:  POSSESSION OF THC (TETRAHYDROCANNABINOLS) - 2ND AND SUBSEQUENT OFFENSE, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 961.41(3g)(e), 939.50(3)(i), a Class I FELONY.
Filed by defense:  Motion for Adjournment.

Defendant Marcello L Holland in court with attorney Richard Jeffrey Carpenter.  Defendant Marcello L Holland in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
